required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase Ⅱ Trials of Sintilimab as Consolidation Therapy After Radical Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy in Locally Advanced Unresectable ESCC
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ⅱ Trials of Sintilimab as Consolidation Therapy After Radical Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy in Locally Advanced Unresectable ESCC

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to observe and evaluate the efficacy and safety of Sintilimab for Consolidation Therapy After Radical Concurrent Chemoradiotherapy for Locally Advanced Unresectable Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma

detailed_description.textblock: In China, the incidence of esophageal cancer has declined in recent years, but the mortality rate has been ranked fourth. Morbidity and mortality were ranked sixth and fourth in all malignancies, respectively. Therefore, esophageal cancer has always been a major malignant tumor that threatens the health of our residents.We designed a single-arm, open-label, phase II trial of Sintilimab for consolidation therapy after radical concurrent chemoradiotherapylocally advanced esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.The purpose of this study is to observe and evaluate the efficacy and safety of Sintilimab for consolidation therapy after radical concurrent chemoradiotherapy for locally advanced unresectable esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of anti-PD-1 antibody Sintilimab for progression-free survival in patients with locally advanced unresectable esophageal squamous cell carcinoma who did not develop disease after radical concurrent chemoradiotherapy

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the objective response rate (objective response rate, ORR) of Sintilimab in patients with locally advanced esophageal squamous cell carcinoma who have not progressed after concurrent radiotherapy and chemotherapy

other_outcome.description: From date of randomization until the date of death from any cause

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory analysis of biomarkers for predicting efficacy
other_outcome.description: The relationship between PD-L1 dynamic expression, ctDNA sequencing and therapeutic effect was evaluated

intervention.description: The first stage:concurrent chemoradiotherapy，cisplatin，25-30mg/m2 ivgtt d1;capecitabine,800mg/m2, bid d1-5，qw，5weeks;concurrent radiotherapy,1.8-2Gy/d，5d/W，50-50.4Gy. second stage:Sintilimab, 200mg,q3w, a total of 3 times，Each infusion lasted for 30-60 min until disease progression or intolerable toxicity, with a maximum duration of no more than 12 months.

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

facility.name: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University
